projectDesc.p: The Greenfield Digital Project interprets the story of Bankers Trust Company, a large Philadelphia bank that failed in 1930, through a selection of primary source documents, contextual essays, and teacher resources. The project is part of a larger effort funded by the Albert M. Greenfield Foundation to make HSP's 20th-century holdings more accessible.

editorialDecl.p: This electronic file was created using manual keying following the recommendations for Level 4 of "Best Practices for TEI in Libraries" guidelines v3.0.

We have regularized spacing between words and sentences to replace double (or triple) spaces to a single space.
We have not coded line breaks, end-of-line hyphenation, visual rendition of layout, font changes, or text alignment (left, right, center).

div.p: We are glad to welcome into Bankers Trust Company of Philadelphia depositors of Metropolitan Trust Company. Under an agreement made today the business of the two banks is consolidated and all deposits of Metropolitan Trust Company are assumed by Bankers Trust Company.

Officers of Bankers Trust Company hope for an early opportunity to meet the depositors and others who have been doing business with Metropolitan Trust Company. They may confidently expect hearty welcome, careful attention, ready service and every regard for their interests and welfare.

closer.signed: BANKERS TRUST COMPANY OF PHILADELPHIA SAMUEL H. BARKER President FRANK H. TUFT, Vice President
